text: Gohar Ayub Khan (; 8 January 1937 â€“ 17 November 2023) was a Pakistani politician, businessman and retired army officer. He was a member of the Pakistan Muslim League. He was the Minister of Foreign Affairs during the administration of Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif from 1997 to 1998. Ayub Khan was also the 14th Speaker of the National Assembly from 1990 to 1993. Ayub Khan died on 17 November 2023 at a hospital in Islamabad, Pakistan from a short- illness at the age of 86.Ex-foreign minister Gohar Ayub Khan dies ==References== ==Other websites== * Universal Insurance: Board of Directors Category:1937 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Speakers of the National Assembly of Pakistan Category:Pakistani military people Category:Pakistani businesspeople Category:Politicians from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
title: Gohar Ayub Khan
